Review.Titre: Good program, iffy team and billing
Review.Contenu: The service itself is great and rather fairly priced, plenty of UI for the average user but also good options for more advanced users. The billing system is a bit clunky, and it took me several emails to cancel an invoice even though I had never enabled auto renew or autobilling however.Edit: (From 3 stars to 2) I have been sent a reply telling me that even though I disabled auto renew from day one and have never considered turning it on for any of the many services I have paid the company for, auto renew is one even when you turn it off as for guard is a “recurring service” so expect to have to navigate emails and stubborn support if you ever choose to stop using the service. Not to mention that support will try to lure you into more purchases when you try to cancel an automatic invoice for which you didn’t sign up. (There are options to disabling auto renew and auto billing, even if you disable them the support team will act as though you kept them enabled.)  However I’d still like to emphasize that the service itself is excellent. Just don’t expect much from customer support.

Review.Titre: Happy VPN customer since 2014, Very unhappy dedicated IP customer.
Review.Contenu: Their VPN service is OK, but dedicated IP service is no good. I purchased 4 different dedicated IP's from them over the years (the most recent one was about 9 months ago), Every single one of these IP's got detected one way or another especially by google captcha everywhere.Which I don't understand why because they are supposed to be dedicated (supposedly Only I get to use them) so how are other people using them :|And IP number 4, I used it for like 2 months just fine, Then they simply blocked HTTP access (because they were getting DDOSed per customer support) and after about 4 months of wait hoping they would restore service soon, I E-Mailed support again and they pretended like the IP I purchased was never supposed to be used over HTTP and said I would not be able to use the IP over HTTP ever again. Which is not true at all and they even detail how to use it on their own website and how to use it with foxy-proxy too. So now I payed $40 for a 2 years subscription for a useless dedicated  IP address. And when I asked for a refund, I was told to hit the door. Never using their services ever again. Not even for regular VPN.

Been using TorGuard since 2019 on my laptop (2.4Ghz quad core) and tower (4.2Ghz, 16GB ram.) On both machines run Win10 with latest updates. TorGuard is always slow to connect, takes about 2 minutes to fully verify with their proprietary "WireGuard". Connection drops sometimes regardless of what server you pick. If ever the app is open but not active, all internet traffic is stopped. Sometimes after closing TorGuard my WiFi adapter craps itself completely, wont reconnect to wifi unless system reboot. After using for 4 years I would say TorGuard is slow, but does a good job overall for the discounted price of $30 USD/ year. Not terrible but not amazing either.

Review.Titre: Solid but plenty of Torguard IPs are blocked
Review.Contenu: The service seems solid (no disconnections so far) but in reality a bit of hit and miss. In particular I surprisingly realized some Torguard IPs are blocked in a couple of countries I have tried and some popular websites are showing the dreaded Cloudflare IP blocked page and not reachable.This seems such a shame in 2023 with all the other VPNs doing a better job at rotating IPs. I even tried their Streaming IP to no avail.Support is prompt to answer but in one occasion the person completely misread my messages. In the others the problem of IP blocking was dismissed.

Overall the Torguard VPN worked well once everything was up and running.  I never did figure out how to get it to connect automatically on Windows start up.  I had to start it manually.  I also had some issues with it not waking up after the computer was restarted after being in sleep mode for a while.  I found the customer support process clunky and difficult.  I was satisfied with the VPN when it was up and running.

My connection to TorGuard kept disconnecting while I was out of the country in Mexico. Every time I picked up my phone I had to check to see whether the VPN was connected spending six weeks away in Mexico. It got tiresome.

I know the manual. I was looking for some help. There has to be a good setting to get better speed on a Android smart TV using Nvidia Shield.

Review.Titre: Torguard good overall, some issues this year that were resolved
Review.Contenu: I've used TorGuard VPN for several years. There was a period in 2021 where I would frequently lose internet while connected to the VPN. Sometimes I would have to switch to a different VPN server to get it to work again.I'm not sure if something was fixed but I can't remember that I've had this issue within the past month or so.

Your service which I have used for many years has worked reliably and I have always received prompt and helpful response when experiencing problems. My one beef would be that the service seems aimed at the technically sophisticated. I am reasonably knowledgeable about the technology in general terms but lack ready understanding of some of the details. Some lower level documents in the help area explaining in general how TorGuard vpn works with explanations of some of the technical terms would be useful for me.

Review.Titre: It's been pretty good but from time to…
Review.Contenu: It's been pretty good but from time to time two errors will appear. First one says Error: The I/O Operation has been aborted because of either a thread exit or an application request. Second one says Error: The Network connection was aborted by the local system.Thank you

Review.Titre: When it works it is great but when it…
Review.Contenu: When it works it is great but when it bugs our it is an uphill struggle to get it to work. The only other real issue is the fact that it is detected as using a vpn. The staff are usually very helpful even though they may be a bit slow with their email replies. The price is fair for the quality even if it slows down frequently.

Review.Titre: I've had Torguard for around 6 years…
Review.Contenu: I've had Torguard for around 6 years now and I'm guessing that the $36 yer annum is pretty reasonable. The problem I have with Torguard is the blocked sites. I find that quite often, I have to turn off the VPN as sites just won't let me on while the VPN is engaged. This is very aggravating to me. I do not have any experience with other VPN companies other than Torguard and can only rely on reviews on the Web and Youtube most of which are usually affiliates getting kick-backs from the respective companies that get the most favorable reviews. VPN service is very difficult to qualify as absolutely required. I use it exclusively for torrenting.

Review.Titre: Used Torguard for 4+ years, then left
Review.Contenu: Used Torguard for 4+ years and it worked well in general. Encountered some problems this year (2021) with some streaming services. Customer support tried to upsell a residential IP address which did not sit well. Moved to NordVPN which include many more VPN servers, and includes proxy servers, and a "SmartDNS" feature. The SmartDNS has worked quite well. Torguard would be well advised to include those features as part of their core offering.

Signed up for an offer, items never were fulfilled, was given an option to extend service. When my current plan was due to expire, they re-neged on said offer, and just gave 50%. Feels bait and switch. Reps were pretty rude. Will look for a new VPN after this expires.

Review.Titre: Not bad but you can be a beter
Very slow to connect and disconnect
Review.Contenu: Very slow to connect and disconnect, add to that that Windows 10 is always resetting (for your own security protection is the official word) itself with more frequency lately I have to constantly download tor-guard over and over. (yes I know I can reset that) I just like things to be easier not harder when you purchase a service.

Review.Titre: TorGuard is slower than the competition
Review.Contenu: I have had TorGuard for over 4 years. I have found Torguard is Much Slower than the other three VPN's I have tried lately. I live fairly close to the geographic center of the lower 48 United States. I always start with the servers closest to my location and then progress to those servers farther away trying for a fast connection. I prefer Wireguard, but I have also tried OpenConnect and both types of OpenVPN, and no matter the connection type or location, Torguard Always lags well behind the others in both download/upload speeds and ping (3 or 4 and occasionally 5 times longer ping times than the other Vpn's with the same server locations).  I use VPN connections on three very different Windows computers - Asus, Dell, & H.P. - all with hard-wired connections to my gigabit router. Torguard is just plain slow compared to some of the competition.

Review.Titre: After the first month I wasn't so sure…
Review.Contenu: After the first month I wasn't so sure on the speeds, then the next 2 months were almost as fast as my internet without a VPN. Then this last month the speeds were horrendous. I only continued the subscription this time on faith that the speeds will be up to the standard that I experienced those 2 months.

Review.Titre: The Windows app is just a mess
Review.Contenu: The Windows app is just a mess, crashes constantly and I just couldn't set up the VPN to work. Sorry guys, but I would've loved to see that app working. Anyway, as a first impression after that I just wanted to go back to ProtonVPN even if it's a lot more expensive, it's worth the money for the quality of the service. Their app never crushed in 2 years.But one thing they've got right is the customer support. Awesome and on point. So it's about three stars from me

PROSVery good price.Responsive customer service.Linux GUI!CONSA fairly large number of websites do not work with TorGuard (I've used other VPNs that didn't have that much of a problem).There is no whitelist feature to allow some apps/urls to not use the VPN.TorGuard starts automatically when I boot my computer but I don't see the icon, thus I have to go to the command line and kill the process if I want to disable it.

Good prices available if you looking for sales, great speed available with their wire guard services. Servers are enough but not great for everyone, such as those in certain parts of europe and australia. The biggest issue I have is major lagging between pages in their IOS and Win10 applications and connection times are sometimes not so great on Win10 whereas the IOS version seems to cut out my internet sometimes. When it works, it is great though.

As a previous subscriber of PIA, the user experience of using TorGuard is almost the same. However, a better UI for the ios and macos clients would go really well with your fast services. In addition, I think it is best that the subscribers like myself could see the ping of each server on the dropdown list, and also being able to change the servers on the fly, without having to disconnect, select, and reconnect. Again, it is always about convenience these days.

Review.Titre: I had been using TorGuard for several…
Review.Contenu: I had been using TorGuard for several months with no problems, then all of a sudden my dedicated VPN slowed down to a crawl and would not let me stream anything anymore.  I reached out to your tech support and we tried to switch to WireGuard and that helped enough that I could at least do somewhat of streaming without waiting to buffer all the time.  The speed is still half of what I can do without the VPN connected.  Hopefully, the problem will get worked out and it will be as fast as it was.

Review.Titre: Was billed even when I didn’t require services.
Review.Contenu: The service seemed to be ok. I have no way of knowing how good it was or how secure, but I just assume it was solid enough. I stopped using torguard well over 2 years ago and I just kept getting invoices. My account was automatically charged every time.  I accept most responsibility because it was my fault for not spending the time to sit down and cancel the service with their exact instructions. I believe the billing cycle was every 3 months which was an inconvenience too. It would be nice if things went differently for Torguard  and I, but they didn’t. I won’t be saying hi to torguard if I see it at a party.

Review.Titre: The dedicated IP address is very slow…
Review.Contenu: The dedicated IP address is very slow most of the time so I don't use it much!  I was assigned an LA server which I really didn't want. Guess other servers were full.....Contacted you as requested, I received no response or help.  I guess the dedicated IP address isn’t the way to go. Like TorGuard other than that.

Review.Titre: Service is solid however not happy with…
Review.Contenu: Service is solid however not happy with the way they deal with their customers.Announced a new VPN Pro pasn that included a dedicated IP -and- 10gb access. Cost me $4 to convert. Then I was told that the dedicated IP cannot use the 10gb servers. Unbelievable!  They charged me another $4 to revert.Back on my streaming package they gave me an IP that won't support Wireguard so I asked for a different one.... $4 fee!This is BS..... Review.Contenu: IP address and hence location leak when using standard locations.Dedicated IP is working as desired.Dedicated Device (router) firmware would greatly help with designing devices to use TorGuard and those allowed direct access.Currently Asus official router firmware does not allow for selective routing.

Review.Contenu: Not as many servers as competitors, usually one per country, but usually able to log in first go. Client is less powerful / flexible than say NordVPN but this may suit some users. However, it hides itself when prompting for credentials during logon which makes no sense ay all.

Review.Contenu: VPN is very much needed in China as majority of the basic sites needs to be accessed by foreigners especially for work. Review.Titre: It's a good VPN provider but...
Review.Contenu: The speed is okay, the customer service are good but a lot of their IP got blocked in china's firewall and they seems not bothering to do anything about it.Plus the IP is where you connected to and you are using, which is bad if government or ISP are monitoring you.

Review.Titre: My ip was visible to Spectrum
Review.Contenu: My ip was visible to Spectrum so that was the whole point of using the vpn to cover my tracks.  I would assume the configuration out of the box would cover your ip address for standard home internet activity.  I am going to try and do a socks 5 instead for downloading without vpn.

I love your product, but over the past couple of years I have had several interruptions due to that the Torguard has gone into a sleep mode as in gone into waiting and I have had to turn everything off, disconnect whatever I was doing or Downloading, and turn off my Torguard and then reconnect.  Several times I have had to change to Open VPN instead of Wireguard in order to get it to work.  So not happy when that happens.  I have uninstalled and then reinstalled in order to fix the problem from happening again, and sooner or later it happens again.  So that is my complaint.  I hope you can rectify the problem someday.  Lisa Shepherd

Review.Titre: It does it's job but appkill doesn't.
Review.Contenu: It does it's job but I wish the app was a little better. I always have to click on proximity to find the best servers to choose from from. Why is the default set to "custom first" and alphabetical? Those servers are super far away.I tried using the app kill feature, which I think is a great idea, but eventually my browser could no longer access my internet. Restarting my comp didn't help and my other apps worked. I googled my problem and found that I had to disable my appkill feature. I didn't even set my browser to be killed if my VPN turned off! No I'm afraid to use it again because it may happen again.
Price is great, windows app has never felt fast or snappy and crashes from time to time. Only 2 servers in all of Canada, 1 at each end of the country... Up time is 99.9%.

Review.Titre: Good VPN service provider with mediocre desktop application.
Review.Contenu: The speed and customer service are excellent. The desktop application is very slow when connecting and disconnecting from a server. Also, settings cannot be adjusted when you are connected to a server.

Been with TorGuard for six years. The speed is ok but not great. I find only a handful of countries that gave me good internet speed. It can be a chore for new users who have to play around with country/server selection for the best speed. Pros: (1) Stable installation: I have installed Torguard on Windows, Android phone and TVBox with no problems. (2) The price is very good if you got the discounted price. Cons: Log in interface (you have to click that round thing to log in) - it just is so confusing when I log in the first time and subsequent uses makes me disdain it. While browsing MSN feeds, it still showed stuff from my residing country instead of the country (a different) I had sign on to. There are problems with Kill Switch (Torguard auto expire due to inactivity but website and internet is still running). That log in interface is the straw that broke the camels back - so am changing provider.

Simple, easy to use and effective.

Hello Dear Torguard Team,It's been amazing experience with your service through out this past year!I'll give you that, but there were outages here and there and those were unfortunate, Cause i live in Iran,and these inconsistencies aren't all your fault but resides to Iranian Government, Thanks for your help!Besides could you please provide me a little discount to renew my account cause i'm from iran ?Thanks in advance!
Awesome VPN when working. Love the no traffic log feature! Lately, consistent connection for streaming is a bit wanting. All in all, a well performing vpn solution that I would recommend.
Mostly good experience. It’s difficult but not impossible to set up on Synology drives.

Everything is great,the service has been flawless. The only reason I only gave 4 stars is because I wish we could access BBC IPlayer with this service. Any way that is a possibility? Other than that, I have absolutely no complaints.

Review.Titre: As close to 5 stars as you can get
Review.Contenu: No one can ever receive 5 stars. 4.9? 4.8? sure, but never 5 full stars; however, TorGuard gets very close. Hassle free setups, easy to use configurations. It's as solid of a service as any. I highly recommend them.

Overall, I like TorGuard, but I do run into issues with them. For example, Tor only works on my phone now, and I'm using Proton VPN on my computer now because of that. I'm tired of the problems, but customer support is always there and quick to reply, which is appreciated. It is my fault; I have not contacted them about my computer issue as I'm using Proton. I do wish they helped more overall, despite what I said. I most likely will renew as I think I'm grandfathered into a deal. I like to have options, too. This is not a ‘knock’ at you, TorGuard.

Good service with great support.  Large number of servers in different regions with multiple protocols which is a boon wherever Internet Censorship (Middle East) is a thing. Torrents are also supported in some regions. VoIP and other restricted services work well as long as one is connected to speedy servers.Multiple apps accross different ecosystems like iOS, Android, Fire stick, windows, chrome browser, etc.Only downside is that out of their very many servers, only a handful of them can give good download and upload speeds.

TorGuard is a good VPN, and the best for my purposes.It supports unlimited port forwarding (albeit with a slight delay between setting and use), has good speed, and is very customisable in other areas.The only issue is that when connected for long periods of time, it appears to slow down (particularly on certain websites), but this seems to fix itself when disconnecting and reconnecting. This could pose a problem for some, as it has for me, so I cannot give this a five-star review.

Review.Titre: A bit flakey, but okay - it does what I need.
Review.Contenu: Second renewal of a two year period with this VPN. My only criticism is the IOS versions of the app are flakey and often disconnect when the device goes to sleep, not automatically restoring on wake-up, which is annoying. I'm not sure whether there is any chance of data leaking at these times. Such leakage would not matter to me, but others may be more concerned.

Review.Titre: I was with TG for about 4 years and had…
Review.Contenu: I was with TG for about 4 years and had a great experience. Even though I had popup errors I couldn't shake their customer service has always been great. The download speed has been better than my other vpn Nord. The only reason for 4 stars, for me, is their software is a bit confusing if you go to any tab other than the front page. I also wish you could connect to another area on the fly, without having to disconnect and then reconnect.

Review.Titre: It's working great outside of a few…
Review.Contenu: It's working great outside of a few glitches that I attribute to power issues at the main server area that I normally use. If that happens I switch to the next nearest servers and all is OK. I have noticed a drop off in the # of seeds connecting for downloading media lately on the Vuze software. IDK if it's a Torguard problem or not. The system lists hundreds of seeds at times and I only get a few? I may have a bad setting or maybe Vuze isn't what they used to be!

Works great now that i dont use TotalAV anymore… Damn antivirus made TorGuard take extra extra long time connecting to any server. Work this out and it is a 5 star rating from me :-)I have 750/750 fiber internet and TorGuards Norwegian server is capable of this kind of speed, I’m very happy with my choice of VPN :-)

Sometimes my internet connection stops and then I have to stop Torguard and reconnect, sometimes restart my Macbook M1. Very annoying while streaming. Otherwise speed is ok.Also location changing does work 50% of the time.Torguard does have a good support

Review.Titre: Best at what it does, a little clunky, mainstream feature should not be locked under paywall
Review.Contenu: overall reliable services to make browsing more comfortable and private. bypass restriction was working flawlessly, fast and stable connection (depends on how far country you choose). Awesome for gaming. apps is a little bit clunky to navigate, and streaming support was locked behind paywall. but there's one missing feature : split tunneling. I just hoping someday they added this feature.

Review.Titre: What you need , when u need it
Review.Contenu: TorGuard has been good to me. They yake their money when it's due, they don't ask you for it 10 days in advance of my monthly service agreement so as to collect 10 days of interest on it, unlike a familiar San Diego utility. They are very responsive when putting in a work ticket. However, they need to give much better and more thorough instructions in their answers to the questions a user may ask. Oh , the cost!!! Well it's ok. For what im getting and what i pay for if considering the newish layout and features,  im happy with it.

TorGuard is consistent & reliable.  Excellent support too.I do wish that it was a little less complicated, since as soon as things go wrong, I'm lost.  As long as the support continues to be responsive, that isn't much of a problem.

Review.Titre: I renewed my VPN service online
Review.Contenu: I renewed my VPN service online, paying by credit card.  Your website worked well and easily and remembered my details while retaining some anonymity.  Then I considered upgrading to a premium speed, advertised at about $8 per month.  The website wanted to bill me $55 - which is obviously not one year at that price.  There was nowhere which said how many months that was for, or if I had a choice of how many months to sign up for, or if I could cancel.  That is why I only gave four stars.

Review.Titre: The VPN has a large variety of servers
Review.Contenu: The VPN has a large variety of servers, and offers very fast speeds. It also hosts IPs that aren't insta blocked by sites that detect VPNs sometimes. However, it is fairly simple and does not have many features, such as split tunneling.

It works, for my purpose it does what it needs to and being a long time customer I can't complain about the price. I probably could find one for cheaper but after 5 years and zero problems, if it ain't broke why try and fix it?

Review.Titre: TorGuard is a fair option for linux users
Review.Contenu: TorGuard has very low tolerance for peer-to-peer file sharing aka torrenting, but, since this was not the main reason for which I opted for a VPN service, I do not regard it as a significant fault or disadvantage. The subscription is fair-priced, I think, and with close proximity servers selected, I can not even sense the expectedly slower connection speed. As a fedora workstation user, I highly appreciate the linux support, too.

Review.Titre: It is one of the only vpns still…

Love it, feel safe and protected... except the process of disconnecting the service is frustrating as far as the user interface goes... there is a delay between hitting the disconnect button and any feedback as to whether or not itt is disconnecting, which usually encourages more clicking which connects, then disconnects, then connects, then you have to disconnect again. Not the end of the world, but a little frustrating every time I disconnect from the VPN.

Sometimes the waiting time is too long to have a response from the support. And also if one IP doesn’t work properly as expected the fee for any change not have to come from the customer. Otherwise the service is good very good most time the connection is stable and the IP you provided to me personally are very safe so far

Review.Titre: Experience of a long term customer
Review.Contenu: Generally, my experience has been positive. Reduction in network speed appears to be minimal, with my chosen server location. I miss the optional settings I used to be able to manipulate. I frequently fond that Torguard has stopped working overnight, so I have to check before I use links I want protected (banks, military record info, online shopping). I am sure these can be managed, but it is not intuitive.

So there’s just one point. The market synchronized itself and this is not good. Review.Titre: You do a good job of keeping in touch…
